abstract.p: This proposal defines a module for providing conversions between various XPath Data Model datatypes. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 3.0 and XSLT 3.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 3.0.

status.p: Must be ignored, but is required by the schema...

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This module is designed to help datatypes handling, providing conversions between Cryptography is the science of communicating in secret code, by conversion of data with the help of a key. In modern times, cryptography is necessary when communicating over any untrusted medium, particularly the Internet.

div2.head: Namespace conventions
div2.p: The module defined by this document defines functions and elements in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/datatype-conversion. In this document, the dtc prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Error codes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/error. In this document, the err prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.

div2.head: Error management
div2.p: Error conditions are identified by a code (a QName). When such an error condition is reached during the execution of the function, a dynamic error is thrown, with the corresponding error code (as if the standard XPath function error had been called).

div2.head: The crypto:generate-certificate function
div2.p: This function generates a digital certificate.

div2.head: The crypto:validate-certificate function
div2.p: This function validates a digital certificate.

div2.head: The crypto:parse-certificate function
div2.p: This function parses a digital certificate.

div2.head: The crypto:generate-certification-path function
div2.p: This function validates the certification path for a digital certificate.

div2.head: The crypto:validate-certification-path function
div2.p: This function validates the certification path for a digital certificate.

div2.head: The crypto:generate-certification-request function
div2.p: This function generates a certificate signing request, in order to apply for a digital identity certificate, which is to be issued by a Certificate Authority .

div2.head: The crypto:validate-certification-request function
div2.p: This function validates a certificate signing request.
